intro: Lamourouxia multifida var. grandiflora, commonly known as the giant fanleaf orchid, is a striking tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, intricately veined, fan-shaped leaves that can reach up to 1 meter in diameter. The plant produces showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white and purple, often arranged in clusters. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
